Hello Everybody,
 My father is a patient of High blood pressure. He is also suffering from problem in liver. Fro last couple of days he is facing a new health ailment. There is a swelling. When I take him to a doctor he told me that this swelling is brought about by water retention due to liver disease. He has prescribed Demadex to my father. Could anyone tell me what are the possible side effects of Demadex. Please help me. I will appreciate any information regarding this.

Hello Patrick,
 Every chemical drug has some or less adverse effect on health and Demadex is not exception of this fact. Along with the desirable effects Demadex causes some unwanted effects. Consult your doctor if any of the following side effects occurs in your father after taking Demadex:
 Dryness of mouth
 Muscle pain or cramp 
 Nausea or vomiting
 Weakness
 dizziness when getting up from a sitting or lying position
 Skin rash
 Consult your physician if you observe any undesirable change in your father. I want to assure you that Demadex is very effective in treatment of high blood pressure and swelling.
